Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup with top of handle zone; interior glazed black with reserved band at junction of lip and body; exterior: lip black; below in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of part of wing of siren or sphinx, possibly to left; dab of added red on wing; inscription incised on exterior of lip.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 55, no. 60)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 414, no. B638)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 8)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 701, no. 583)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0513) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
